intro: Carex wohllebii, commonly known as the Wohlleben's sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to the high-altitude regions of South America, particularly in the Andes. This plant is characterized by its grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows. Carex wohllebii is an important component of the local ecosystem, providing habitat and food for various invertebrates and birds.
